titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Theater Three Collaborative Records, 1970-2014 RL.10145
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-29 18:08:48 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Theater Three Collaborative is a live theater production company creating plays about pressing social issues.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Theater Three Collaborative is a live theater production company creating plays about pressing social issues. It was founded in 1995 by Lee Nagrin, George Bartenieff, and Karen Malpede and is based in Brooklyn, New York.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Theater Three Collaborative Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Theater Three Collaborative Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2014-0062

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists largely of materials from plays written or directed by Theater Three Collaborative co-founder Karen Malpede, including The Beekeeper's Daughter, I Will Bear Witness, Prophecy, Iraq: Speaking of War, Another Life, and Extreme Whether. Each play addressed a social or human rights issue, such as Bosnian refugees, genetic engineering, torture and the Iraq War, global warming, and the Holocaust. Each play's materials usually include drafts and variations of scripts, production notes, publicity, photographs, and press reviews. A small amount of audiovisual material is included and is noted in the finding aid. Also includes some scripts and materials from George Bartenieff's roles in various productions, as well as some of Malpede's writings and essays, including her book The People's Theatre in Amerika.
Additional digital video files have been received but are not yet available for patron access. Contact Research Services with questions about accessing this collection's digital contents.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of the collection is open for research. Digital files are unprocessed and are not available for patron use.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original audiovisual materials, including DVDs, miniDVs, and Betacams, featuring recordings of Theater Three Collaborative performances and rehearsals. Consult the AV inventory for more information.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials are closed to use. Contact Rubenstein in advance of your visit to request the production of access copies.
